detailed_goals: Sketch initial character designs, exploring silhouettes and features.
Create environment concepts, focusing on mood and atmosphere.
Work on prop designs, ensuring they fit the game's style.
Experiment with different color palettes.
Get started on the client-side architecture and UI design.
Set up the basic project structure and implement core UI elements (menus, HUD, settings panels).
Focus on overall architecture, ensuring it's scalable and maintainable.
Take the lead on implementing the UI elements, integrating visual assets from the art team.
Focus on implementing player feedback systems, like tutorials and error message.
Collaborate closely with Leon and Naomi to ensure the UI reflects the game's world and narrative.
Get started on the client-side architecture and UI design.
Set up the basic project structure and implement core UI elements (menus, HUD, settings panels).
Focus on overall architecture, ensuring it's scalable and maintainable.
Take the lead on implementing the UI elements, integrating visual assets from the art team.
Focus on implementing player feedback systems, like tutorials and error message.
Collaborate closely with Leon and Naomi to ensure the UI reflects the game's world and narrative.
Integrate the various game systems, such as combat, economy, and progression.
Ensure that these systems work together seamlessly and create a balanced and engaging gameplay experience.
Integrate the game mechanics, ensure the game systems reflects the game's design and make sure that the systems work well within the levels.
Start implementing core gameplay features, like quests, crafting, and character customization.
Prioritize playtesting and iteration, gathering feedback from the team and making adjustments as needed to create a polished and enjoyable game.
Set up the build environment, configuring the necessary tools and dependencies.
Create build scripts to automate the process of compiling code, generating assets, and packaging the game for different platforms.
Set up a continuous integration (CI) system to automatically build and test the game whenever changes are made to the codebase.
Integrate automated testing frameworks into the CI pipeline to ensure code quality and identify bugs early in the development process.
Configure deployment pipelines to automatically deploy the game to testing environments and eventually to production.
Make sure that the build process and CI system integrate well with the game development pipeline.
Make sure that the automated builds and testing work as expected.
Configure the system to provide detailed build reports and notifications to the development team.
Create a detailed test plan based on the game design document.
Include test cases for all core mechanics, UI elements, levels, and character interactions.
Begin executing test cases, meticulously documenting any bugs or issues.
Pay close attention to performance, stability, and overall gameplay experience.
Conduct ad-hoc testing, exploring the game in unexpected ways to uncover hidden bugs.
Provide regular reports to the development team, detailing findings and prioritizing issues based on severity.
Focus on game mechanics, game design document, level layouts and 3D models to make sure that everything is working together correctly.
Block out the basic shapes for the main characters, focusing on getting the proportions and anatomy right.
Create the environmental models, starting with the larger structures and then adding details.
Begin rigging the characters for animation, paying close attention to joint placement and deformation.
Work on creating a library of animations for basic movements, combat, and interactions.
Use character designs as the base for character models.
Create a detailed project schedule outlining all tasks, dependencies, and deadlines, using the information provided by each team lead.
Use project management software to track progress and identify potential bottlenecks.
Hold regular team meetings to review progress, address challenges, and ensure everyone is aligned.
Ensure that the project schedule aligns with the game's design and the game mechanics.
Send weekly progress reports to executive leadership.
Proactively identify and mitigate risks to keep the project on track.
Make sure that all deliverables are completed on time and to the required quality standards.
Integrate the various game systems, such as combat, economy, and progression.
Ensure that these systems work together seamlessly and create a balanced and engaging gameplay experience.
Integrate the game mechanics, ensure the game systems reflects the game's design and make sure that the systems work well within the levels.
Start implementing core gameplay features, like quests, crafting, and character customization.
Prioritize playtesting and iteration, gathering feedback from the team and making adjustments as needed to create a polished and enjoyable game.
Get started on the client-side architecture and UI design.
Set up the basic project structure and implement core UI elements (menus, HUD, settings panels).
Focus on overall architecture, ensuring it's scalable and maintainable.
Take the lead on implementing the UI elements, integrating visual assets from the art team.
Focus on implementing player feedback systems, like tutorials and error message.
Collaborate closely with Leon and Naomi to ensure the UI reflects the game's world and narrative.
Create wireframes and mockups for the main UI screens, including the main menu, settings, inventory, and HUD.
Focus on creating intuitive layouts that provide players with easy access to important information and actions.
Prototype the UI interactions, ensuring they feel responsive and satisfying.
Pay close attention to typography, color palettes, and overall visual design, making sure the UI is consistent with the game's art style and tone.
Ensure the UI design is technically feasible and integrates well with the client-side architecture.
Make sure the UI reflects the game's world and narrative and is incorporated into the levels correctly.
Test the UI with users and make changes based on their feedback.
Block out the basic shapes for the main characters, focusing on getting the proportions and anatomy right.
Create the environmental models, starting with the larger structures and then adding details.
Begin rigging the characters for animation, paying close attention to joint placement and deformation.
Work on creating a library of animations for basic movements, combat, and interactions.
Use character designs as the base for character models.
Define the core game mechanics, including movement, combat, and interactions.
Create the underlying systems that govern these mechanics, ensuring they're robust and responsive.
Implement the game's physics engine, tweaking it to achieve the desired feel.
Work on AI implementation, ensuring that AI reflects the game's world and narrative.
Document everything thoroughly, so that the other programmers can easily understand and work with the systems I've created.
Use design document as a base for this.
Understand the overall art style and vision for the game.
Ensure that the 3D models and animations are technically sound and optimized for performance.
Ensure that the UI elements are visually appealing and functional.
Define the technical requirements for the art assets, including polygon counts, texture sizes, and animation frame rates.
Work on creating shaders and materials to achieve the desired visual effects.
Make sure that I am utilizing the tools that the Tools Developer is working on to help the art pipeline.
Make sure that the art style reflects the game's design.
Identify the most pressing needs of the development team by consulting with each department lead.
Begin developing custom tools to automate repetitive tasks, streamline workflows, and improve overall efficiency.
Make sure that the tools are well documented and easy to use, providing training and support to the development team.
Focus on integrating the tools with existing systems, ensuring a seamless workflow.
Integrate the tools with the game mechanics and server architecture.
Starting on the initial game concept and design document.
Brainstorm some core game mechanics and a compelling narrative hook.
Sketch out a basic level layout to get a sense of the gameplay flow.
Define the player progression system, outlining how players will advance and unlock new abilities.
Create the document as a foundation for the team to build upon, ensuring everyone is aligned on the game's vision and direction.
Compile a comprehensive list of all required sound effects, categorizing them by type (e.g., character actions, environmental sounds, UI feedback).
Start creating or sourcing these sound assets, making sure to adhere to the game's aesthetic.
Integrate these sounds into the game engine, attaching them to the appropriate events and triggers.
Work on implementing environmental audio, creating soundscapes that enhance the game's atmosphere.
Test and fine-tune the audio mix, ensuring a balanced and immersive experience.
Communicate and work together with 3D modelers and animators to make sure that the sound effects and 3D animation fit well together.
Outline the server architecture, choosing appropriate technologies for the game's needs.
Set up the database schema, defining the structure for storing player data, game state, and other relevant information.
Implement the core server logic, including handling player authentication, managing game sessions, and enforcing game rules.
Create APIs for the client to communicate with the server, ensuring secure and efficient data transfer.
Scalability and security will be a primary focus throughout the development process, implementing measures to prevent cheating and protect player data.
Ensure seamless integration with the game mechanics and ensure the server-side logic aligns with the game's design.
Create the level layouts, focusing on creating interesting and varied environments that complement the gameplay.
Block out the main pathways and areas, ensuring a good flow and pacing.
Start prototyping gameplay scenarios within the levels, experimenting with enemy placement, puzzle design, and environmental challenges.
Work on integrating visual elements, like lighting and set dressing, to enhance the atmosphere and guide the player.
Make sure that the level design supports the game's narrative and mechanics.
Make sure that the level designs support the animation and 3D models.
Flesh out the game's lore and backstory, creating a rich and believable world for the players to explore.
Develop the main characters, giving them compelling motivations, relationships, and arcs.
Write the main storyline, weaving in subplots and branching narrative paths to create player choice.
Write all the in-game dialogue, ensuring it's engaging, informative, and consistent with the characters' personalities.
Work on item descriptions, environmental storytelling, and any other text that can add depth and flavor to the game world.
Make sure that the narrative supports the game's design and make sure that the dialogue reflects the game's mechanics.
